paragraphs.text:
%md
### Antes de comenzar
#### En máquina virtual o nabuco
1. Lanzar terminal
1. Actualizar repo:
```sh
cd diplodatos_bigdata
git pull
```
1. Lanzar virtualenv python
```sh
cd
. spark/python/zeppelin/bin/activate
```

1. Lanzar [Zeppelin](http://zeppelin.apache.org/):
```sh
cd spark/zeppelin-0.7.3-bin-all
./bin/zeppelin-daemon.sh start
```
1. En navegador abrir [http://localhost:8080](http://localhost:8080)
1. Seleccionar `Import note`
1. Elegir json en `diplodatos_bigdata/clases/05_ml/note.json`
2. Seleccionar `Clase 05 - Machine Learning`

#### En notebook instalar Python Matplotlib y Pandas

* En la terminal ejecutar
```sh
sudo apt-get install python-matplotlib python-pandas python-plotly
```

msg.data:
Antes de comenzar

En máquina virtual o nabuco

  1. Lanzar terminal

  2. Actualizar repo:

    cd diplodatos_bigdata
git pull

  3. Lanzar virtualenv python

    cd
. spark/python/zeppelin/bin/activate

  4. Lanzar Zeppelin:

    cd spark/zeppelin-0.7.3-bin-all
./bin/zeppelin-daemon.sh start
  5. En navegador abrir http://localhost:8080
  6. Seleccionar Import note
  7. Elegir json en diplodatos_bigdata/clases/05_ml/note.json
  8. Seleccionar Clase 05 - Machine Learning

En notebook instalar Python Matplotlib y Pandas

  • En la terminal ejecutar

    sudo apt-get install python-matplotlib python-pandas python-plotly

paragraphs.text:
%md
# Machine Learning

%md
### Programación tradicional

%%% yuml type=class style=plain format=svg
  [note:Datos Entrada{bg:cornsilk}]->[Algoritmo{bg:red}]
  [Algoritmo{bg:red}]->[note:Datos Salida{bg:cornsilk}]
%%%

%md
### Machine Learning

Algoritmos que generan algoritmos.

%md
#### Entrenamiento:
%%% yuml type=class style=plain format=svg
  [note:Datos;Entrenamiento{bg:cornsilk}]->[Algoritmo;ML{bg:red}]
  [Algoritmo;ML{bg:red}]->[note:Algoritmo;(modelo){bg:orange}]
%%%

%md
#### Uso:

%%% yuml type=class style=plain format=svg
  [note:Datos Entrada{bg:cornsilk}]->[Algoritmo;(modelo){bg:orange}]
  [Algoritmo;(Modelo)]->[note:Datos Salida{bg:cornsilk}]
%%%

%md
%%% yuml type=class style=plain dir=lr format=svg
  [note:Datos;Entrenamiento{bg:cornsilk}]->[Algoritmo;ML]
  [Algoritmo;ML{bg:red}]->[Algoritmo;(modelo){bg:orange}]
  [note:Datos Entrada{bg:cornsilk}]->[Algoritmo;(modelo){bg:orange}]
  [Algoritmo;(Modelo)]->[note:Datos Salida{bg:cornsilk}]
%%%

%md
### Machine Learning en Spark

Objetos **Estimator** y **Transformer**.

%md
#### Entrenamiento:

%%% yuml type=class style=plain format=svg
  [note:Dataframe;Entrenamiento{bg:cornsilk}]->[Estimator;(algoritmo ML)|fit()]
  [Estimator;(algoritmo ML)|fit(){bg:red}]->[note:Transformer;(modelo){bg:orange}]
%%%

%md
#### Uso:

%%% yuml type=class style=plain format=svg
  [note:Dataframe;Entrada{bg:cornsilk}]->[Transformer;(modelo)|transform(){bg:orange}]
  [Transformer;(modelo)|transform(){bg:orange}]->[note:Dataframe;Salida{bg:cornsilk}]
%%%

%md
## Ejemplo

### Predicción de género a partir del peso y la altura.

msg.data:
Ejemplo

Predicción de género a partir del peso y la altura.

paragraphs.title: Read file
paragraphs.text:
val inputFile = "/home/guest/curso_vates/ds/people_sex_height_age_weight.json"

val people = spark.read.json(inputFile)
    .select($"kgs", $"mts", $"sex")
    .repartition(sc.defaultParallelism)
    .cache
    
people.count

z.show(people.sample(false,0.001),5)

paragraphs.title: Datos para entrenamiento y test
paragraphs.text:
val Array(trainDF, testDF) = people.randomSplit(Array(0.95, 0.05)) 

testDF.count
trainDF.count

paragraphs.title: Features
paragraphs.text:
%md
### Features

Los algoritmos ML utilizan datos numeŕicos:

* Como **entrada** toman un vector numérico - **vector de features**
* Como predicción de **salida** producen números - **labels**

Por lo tanto hay que trasnsformar los datos de entrada.

msg.data:
Features

Los algoritmos ML utilizan datos numeŕicos:

  • Como entrada toman un vector numérico - vector de features
  • Como predicción de salida producen números - labels

Por lo tanto hay que trasnsformar los datos de entrada.

paragraphs.title: Creación de vector de features (entrada)
paragraphs.text:
import org.apache.spark.ml.feature.VectorAssembler

val vAssembler = new VectorAssembler()
  .setInputCols(Array("kgs", "mts"))
  .setOutputCol("features")

val trainAssembled = vAssembler.transform(trainDF)

z.show(trainAssembled,5)

%md
#### VectorAssembler es un **Transformer**

%%% yuml type=class style=plain format=svg
  [note:trainDF{bg:cornsilk}]->[vAssembler;(modelo)|transform(){bg:orange}]
  [vAssembler;(modelo)|transform(){bg:orange}]->[note:trainAssembled{bg:cornsilk}]
%%%

paragraphs.title: Creación de Labels (predicción)
paragraphs.text: %md Es necesario leer toda la entrada.

msg.data: Es necesario leer toda la entrada.

paragraphs.title: Creación de Labels
paragraphs.text:
import org.apache.spark.ml.feature.StringIndexer

val strIndexer = new StringIndexer()
  .setInputCol("sex")
  .setOutputCol("label")

// indexer tiene que leer la entrada
val sexIndexer = strIndexer.fit(trainAssembled)

val trainFeaturized = sexIndexer.transform(trainAssembled)

z.show(trainFeaturized,5)

%md
#### StringIndexer es un Estimator

%%% yuml type=class style=plain format=svg
  [note:trainAssembled{bg:cornsilk}]->[strIdexer;(algoritmo)|fit(){bg:red}]
  [strIdexer;(algoritmo)|fit(){bg:red}]->[note:sexIndexer;(model){bg:orange}]
%%%

%%% yuml type=class style=plain format=svg
  [note:trainAssembled{bg:cornsilk}]->[sexIndexer;(model)|transform(){bg:orange}]
  [sexIndexer;(model)|transform(){bg:orange}]->[note:trainFeaturized{bg:cornsilk}]
%%%

#### Más información
* [Spark Docs - Extracting, transforming and selecting features](http://spark.apache.org/docs/latest/ml-features.html).

msg.data:
StringIndexer es un Estimator

Más información

  • Spark Docs - Extracting, transforming and selecting features.

paragraphs.text:
%md
### Visualización

paragraphs.title: Image plotter en Python
paragraphs.text:
%pyspark def plot_classification(nomTable="test",surfaceTable="grid", prob=False): import matplotlib.pyplot as plt import numpy as np import matplotlib.cm as cm from matplotlib.colors import ListedColormap, LinearSegmentedColormap cmap_light = LinearSegmentedColormap.from_list("light", ['#FF5555', '#5555FF']) cmap_pastel = LinearSegmentedColormap.from_list("pastel", ['#FF8888', '#8888FF']) cmap_bold = ListedColormap(['#FF0000', '#00FF00', '#0000FF']) # helper function to display in Zeppelin def show(p): import StringIO img = StringIO.StringIO() p.savefig(img, format='png')#,dpi=600) img.seek(0) print "%html
" plt.close('all') plt.autoscale(enable=True, axis='x', tight=True) if surfaceTable: sTable = sqlContext.table(surfaceTable) if prob: pSTable = sTable.select('kgs','mts','prob').toPandas() Z = pSTable['prob'] else: pSTable = sTable.select('kgs','mts','prediction').toPandas() Z = pSTable['prediction'] xs = pSTable['kgs'] ys = pSTable['mts'] xUs = xs.unique() yUs = ys.unique() xx, yy = np.meshgrid(xUs,yUs) Z = Z.values.reshape(xx.shape).transpose() if prob: plt.pcolormesh(xx, yy, Z, cmap=cmap_light) else: plt.pcolormesh(xx, yy, Z, cmap=cmap_pastel) plt.axis([xs.min(), xs.max(), ys.min(), ys.max()]) table = sqlContext.table(nomTable) pTable = table.select('kgs','mts','label').toPandas().sample(frac=1) xs = pTable['kgs'] ys = pTable['mts'] cs = pTable['label'] plt.scatter(xs, ys, c=cs, cmap=cmap_bold, alpha=0.5, s=16) plt.xlabel('kgs') plt.ylabel('mts') show(plt) plt.close()

paragraphs.title: Share table with Python
paragraphs.text: trainFeaturized.createOrReplaceTempView("trainFeaturized")

paragraphs.title: Plot train data
paragraphs.text:
%pyspark
plot_classification(nomTable="trainFeaturized", surfaceTable="")

%md
## Clasificación

%md
### Decision Tree

paragraphs.title: Entrenamiento
paragraphs.text:
import org.apache.spark.ml.classification.DecisionTreeClassifier

// Se crea el Estimator
val dtEstimator = new DecisionTreeClassifier()
                .setFeaturesCol("features")
                .setLabelCol("label")

//dtEstimator.explainParams

val dtModel = dtEstimator.fit(trainFeaturized)

%md
%%% yuml type=class style=plain format=svg
  [note:trainFeaturized{bg:cornsilk}]->[dtEstimator;(algoritmo ML)|fit(){bg:red}]
  [dtEstimator;(algoritmo ML)|fit(){bg:red}]->[note:dtModel;(model){bg:orange}]
%%%

paragraphs.title: Probando el modelo
paragraphs.text:
{ val kgs = z.input("Peso en kilos:","80.0").toString.toDouble val mts = z.input("Altura en metros:","1.8").toString.toDouble val dfOneInput = Seq((kgs,mts)).toDF("kgs","mts") val dfOneFeaturized = vAssembler.transform(dfOneInput) val dfOnePrediction = dtModel.transform(dfOneFeaturized) val labels = sexIndexer.labels val num2Gen = (n:Double) => if (labels(n.toInt) == "F") "femenino" else "masculino" val genre = num2Gen(dfOnePrediction.first.getDouble(5)) println(s"""%html

Género: $genre

""") }

paragraphs.title: Featurize test
paragraphs.text:
val testAssembled = vAssembler.transform(testDF)
val testFeaturized = sexIndexer.transform(testAssembled)

z.show(testFeaturized,5)

testFeaturized.createOrReplaceTempView("testFeaturized")

paragraphs.title: Background grid kgs*mts
Background Grid Prediction
paragraphs.text:
// Creo predicciones de la grilla
val gridPredictionDT = dtModel.transform(grid)

z.show(gridPredictionDT,5)

gridPredictionDT.createOrReplaceTempView("gridPredictionDT")

paragraphs.title: Plot Decision Tree Predictions
paragraphs.text:
%pyspark
plot_classification(nomTable="testFeaturized", surfaceTable="gridPredictionDT")

paragraphs.title: Ejercicio
paragraphs.text:
%md
Modifique el siguiente programa para aumentar la **profundidad** del árbol de decisión a 10.

#### Ayuda

* Busque en documentación [API Spark - Decision Trees](http://spark.apache.org/docs/latest/api/scala/index.html#org.apache.spark.ml.classification.DecisionTreeClassifier) el *parameter setter*.

msg.data:

Ayuda

  • Busque en documentación API Spark - Decision Trees el parameter setter.

paragraphs.title: Plot Decision Tree Predictions
paragraphs.text:
%pyspark
plot_classification(nomTable="testFeaturized", surfaceTable="gridPredictionDT2")

%md

### Random Forest

paragraphs.title: Creación del modelo
paragraphs.text:
import org.apache.spark.ml.classification.RandomForestClassifier


val rfEstimator = new RandomForestClassifier()
                .setFeaturesCol("features")
                .setLabelCol("label")
                .setNumTrees(100)

val rfModel = rfEstimator.fit(trainFeaturized)

paragraphs.title: Background Grid Prediction
paragraphs.text:
val gridPredictionRF = rfModel.transform(grid)

gridPredictionRF.createOrReplaceTempView("gridPredictionRF")

paragraphs.title: Plot Random Forest
paragraphs.text:
%pyspark

plot_classification(nomTable="testFeaturized", surfaceTable="gridPredictionRF")

%md

### Logistic Regression

paragraphs.title: Creación del modelo
paragraphs.text:
import org.apache.spark.ml.classification.LogisticRegression

val lrEstimator = new LogisticRegression()
  .setMaxIter(100)
  .setRegParam(0.01)

val lrModel = lrEstimator.fit(trainFeaturized)

paragraphs.title: Probando el modelo
paragraphs.text:
{ val kgs = z.input("Peso en kilos:","80.0").toString.toDouble val mts = z.input("Altura en metros:","1.8").toString.toDouble val dfOneInput = Seq((kgs,mts)).toDF("kgs","mts") val dfOneFeaturized = vAssembler.transform(dfOneInput) val dfOnePrediction = lrModel.transform(dfOneFeaturized) val labels = sexIndexer.labels val posF = if (labels(0) == "F") 0 else 1 val femProb : Double = dfOnePrediction.first .getAs[org.apache.spark.ml.linalg.DenseVector](4)(posF) val femProbPerc : Int = (100.0 * femProb).ceil.toInt println(s"""%html

Probabilidad que sea mujer: $femProbPerc %

""") }

paragraphs.title: Background Grid Prediction
paragraphs.text:
import org.apache.spark.ml.linalg.Vector

val gridPredictionLR = lrModel.transform(grid)

val vec2ColUDF = udf((x:Vector, index: Int) => x(index))

gridPredictionLR
    .select($"*",vec2ColUDF($"probability",lit(1)).as("prob"))
    .createOrReplaceTempView("gridPredictionLR")

paragraphs.title: Plot Logistic Regression
paragraphs.text:
%pyspark

plot_classification(nomTable="testFeaturized", surfaceTable="gridPredictionLR", prob=True)

paragraphs.title: Logistic Regression with Poly expansion
paragraphs.text:
%md

* El algoritmo ML *Logistic Regression* es un algoritmo de clasificación logísitica **lineal**. 
* Esta limitación puede salvarse aumentando la dimensión del espacio:

    ![](https://bytebucket.org/bigdata_famaf/curso_vates/raw/HEAD/clases/05_ml/dimension_expansion.png)

### Para lograrlo puede utilizarse [Spark Polinomial Expansion](http://spark.apache.org/docs/latest/ml-features.html#polynomialexpansion).

msg.data:
• El algoritmo ML Logistic Regression es un algoritmo de clasificación logísitica lineal.
  • Esta limitación puede salvarse aumentando la dimensión del espacio:

Para lograrlo puede utilizarse Spark Polinomial Expansion.

paragraphs.title: Ejercicio
paragraphs.text:
%md

Modificar el siguiente programa para utilizar [Spark Polinomial Expansion](http://spark.apache.org/docs/latest/ml-features.html#polynomialexpansion).

msg.data: Modificar el siguiente programa para utilizar Spark Polinomial Expansion.

paragraphs.title: Logistic Regression with Poly expansion
paragraphs.text:
import org.apache.spark.ml.feature.PolynomialExpansion

val polyExpansion = new PolynomialExpansion()
  .setInputCol("features")
  .setOutputCol("features_expansion")
  .setDegree(...) // llenar (ver documentacion)

val lrEstimatorPoly = new LogisticRegression()
  .setFeaturesCol(...) // llenar
  .setMaxIter(100)
  .setRegParam(0.01)

val trainFeaturizedPoly = polyExpansion.transform(trainFeaturized)

val lrModelPoly = lrEstimatorPoly.fit(...) // llenar


val gridPoly = polyExpansion.transform(grid)

val gridPredictionLRPoly = lrModelPoly.transform(gridPoly)

gridPredictionLRPoly
    .select($"*",vec2ColUDF($"probability",lit(1)).as("prob"))
    .createOrReplaceTempView("gridPredictionLRPoly")

%pyspark

plot_classification(nomTable="testFeaturized", surfaceTable="gridPredictionLRPoly", prob=True)

%md
## Clustering

paragraphs.title: Create sample data
paragraphs.text:
import org.apache.spark.ml.clustering.KMeans
import org.apache.spark.ml.linalg.{Vector,Vectors}
import org.apache.spark.sql.{DataFrame, Row}
import org.apache.spark.mllib.random.RandomRDDs.normalVectorRDD

val dimension = 3
val cantVect = 50
val disper = 5.0

val dataset1 = normalVectorRDD(sc, cantVect, dimension).
    map(v => Tuple1.apply(Vectors.dense(v(0), v(1), v(2)))).toDF("features")

val dataset2 = normalVectorRDD(sc, cantVect, dimension).
    map(v => Tuple1.apply(Vectors.dense(v(0)+disper, v(1), v(2)))).toDF("features")

val dataset3 = normalVectorRDD(sc, cantVect, dimension).
    map(v => Tuple1.apply(Vectors.dense(v(0), v(1)+disper, v(2)))).toDF("features")

val dataset4 = normalVectorRDD(sc, cantVect, dimension).
    map(v => Tuple1.apply(Vectors.dense(v(0), v(1), v(2)+disper))).toDF("features")

val dataset5 = normalVectorRDD(sc, cantVect, dimension).
    map(v => Tuple1.apply(Vectors.dense(v(0)+disper, v(1)+disper, v(2)+disper))).toDF("features")

val dataset = dataset1.union(dataset2).union(dataset3).union(dataset4).union(dataset5)

paragraphs.title: Python plotter
paragraphs.text:
%pyspark def plot_clustering(nomTable="evalData", nomTableCenters=""): import plotly as py import plotly.graph_objs as go pltWidth = 800 pltHeight = 600 def plot(plot_dic, width=pltWidth, **kwargs): kwargs['output_type'] = 'div' plot_str = py.offline.plot(plot_dic, **kwargs) print('%%html
%s
' % (width, plot_str)) pEvalData = sqlContext.table(nomTable).toPandas() if nomTableCenters: pEvalCenters = sqlContext.table(nomTableCenters).toPandas() eData = go.Scatter3d( x=pEvalData.x, y=pEvalData.y, z=pEvalData.z, showlegend=False, mode='markers', marker=dict( size=1.5, color=pEvalData.prediction, # set color to an array/list of desired values colorscale='Rainbow' # choose a colorscale ), opacity=0.6 ) eCenters = go.Scatter3d( x=pEvalCenters.x, y=pEvalCenters.y, z=pEvalCenters.z, showlegend=False, mode='markers', marker=dict( size=3, line = dict( width = 1, color = 'black' ), symbol='x', color=pEvalCenters.prediction, # set color to an array/list of desired values colorscale='Rainbow' # choose a colorscale ), opacity=1.0 ) data = [eData,eCenters] layout = go.Layout( title="Clusters", width=pltWidth, height=pltHeight ) else: eData = go.Scatter3d( x=pEvalData.x, y=pEvalData.y, z=pEvalData.z, showlegend=False, mode='markers', marker=dict( size=1.5, line = dict( width = 1, color = 'black' ), color='cyan' ), opacity=0.8 ) data = [eData] layout = go.Layout( title="Data", width=pltWidth, height=pltHeight ) plot({ "data": data, "layout": layout })

paragraphs.title: Send table to Python
paragraphs.text:
val vec2ColUDF = udf((x:Vector, index: Int) => x(index))

val dsFeatures = dataset 
                .select(vec2ColUDF($"features",lit(0)).as("x"), vec2ColUDF($"features",lit(1)).as("y"), 
                        vec2ColUDF($"features",lit(2)).as("z"))

dsFeatures.createOrReplaceTempView("dsFeatures")

paragraphs.title: Plot data
paragraphs.text:
%pyspark
plot_clustering(nomTable="dsFeatures",nomTableCenters="")

paragraphs.title: Create k-means model
paragraphs.text:
val kmeans = new KMeans()
  .setK(5)                              // set number of clusters
  .setFeaturesCol("features")
  .setPredictionCol("prediction")

val model = kmeans.fit(dataset)

paragraphs.title: Eval data with model
paragraphs.text:
val vec2ColUDF = udf((x:Vector, index: Int) => x(index))

val evalData = model.transform(dataset).
    select(vec2ColUDF($"features",lit(0)).as("x"), vec2ColUDF($"features",lit(1)).as("y"), 
            vec2ColUDF($"features",lit(2)).as("z"), 'prediction)

evalData.createOrReplaceTempView("evalData")

val centers = model.
    transform(spark.createDataFrame(model.clusterCenters.map(Tuple1.apply)).toDF("features"))

val evalCenters = centers.
    select(vec2ColUDF('features,lit(0)).as("x"), vec2ColUDF('features,lit(1)).as("y"), 
            vec2ColUDF('features,lit(2)).as("z"), 'prediction)

evalCenters.createOrReplaceTempView("evalCenters")

paragraphs.title: Show clusters
paragraphs.text:
%pyspark
plot_clustering(nomTable="evalData",nomTableCenters="evalCenters")

paragraphs.title: FIN

msg.data:
<script>
    var heads = document.getElementsByTagName('h2');
    var numHeads = heads.length;
    var inner = "";
    var i = 0;
    var j = 0;
    while (i < numHeads){
        inner = heads[i].innerHTML;
        if (inner.search(".-") != -1 ) {
            j++;
            heads[i].innerHTML = inner.replace(/(~|\d+)\.-/,""+j+".-");
        }
        i++
    }
</script>
